issue.description:
IBC SECTION 1012 RAMPS 1012_2 Slope (part of means of egress).
Ramp slope is 10.0%. The maximum slope for the ramps is 8.0%.
issue.title: Too Steep Ramp: 10.0%

suggestions.action: Redesign the ramp to reduce the slope to 8.0%.
suggestions.reasoning: The ramp currently has a slope of 10.0%, exceeding the maximum allowable slope of 8.0%. Redesigning the ramp will ensure compliance.

suggestions.action: Install a vertical lift adjacent to the ramp.
suggestions.reasoning: If space allows, a vertical lift can provide an alternative means of egress for individuals who may struggle with the ramp's slope.

suggestions.action: Add handrails and clear slope markings to the ramp.
suggestions.reasoning: Adding handrails and markings will enhance safety and accessibility while the ramp redesign is being planned.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair Stair.0.3 tread length is 0.20 m. The minimum length for the tread is 0.28 m.
issue.title: Stair.0.3: 0.20 M

suggestions.action: Increase tread length to 0.28 m.
suggestions.reasoning: The current tread length of 0.20 m does not meet the minimum requirement of 0.28 m.

suggestions.action: Redesign the stair with a curved tread to enhance aesthetics and meet length requirements.
suggestions.reasoning: A curved tread can provide a unique design while ensuring the minimum tread length is achieved.

suggestions.action: Implement a modular tread system that allows for adjustable lengths.
suggestions.reasoning: This approach allows for flexibility in design and ensures compliance with the minimum tread length.

issue.description:
307.4 Reduced Vertical Clearance
Underside of stair should be shielded to protect visually impaired persons from accessing it inadvertently.
issue.title: Stair.0.3

suggestions.action: Install a protective barrier at the underside of the stair.
suggestions.reasoning: To prevent visually impaired individuals from inadvertently accessing the stair, a protective barrier should be installed.

suggestions.action: Design a visually striking mural on the underside of the stair to enhance visibility.
suggestions.reasoning: A mural can serve both as a protective measure and an artistic enhancement, making the stair more noticeable to visually impaired individuals.

suggestions.action: Implement a tactile warning strip along the edge of the stair.
suggestions.reasoning: A tactile strip will alert visually impaired individuals to the presence of the stair, providing a physical cue to avoid accidental access.

issue.description:
307.4 Reduced Vertical Clearance
Underside of stair should be shielded to protect visually impaired persons from accessing it inadvertently.
issue.title: Stair.3.2

suggestions.action: Install a solid barrier or guardrail beneath the stair.
suggestions.reasoning: The stair has a top elevation of 36.42, which poses a risk for visually impaired individuals; a barrier will prevent accidental access.

suggestions.action: Implement tactile warning strips or mats at the base of the stair.
suggestions.reasoning: Tactile indicators will provide a physical cue for visually impaired individuals, enhancing safety at the stair's base.

suggestions.action: Integrate motion-sensor lighting or audible alerts near the stair.
suggestions.reasoning: Smart technology can alert individuals approaching the stair, providing an additional safety measure for visually impaired persons.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair SStair.1448 has a landing with clear width of less than the required 0.90 m.
issue.title: Stair.3.2

suggestions.action: Widen the landing to meet the 0.90 m requirement.
suggestions.reasoning: The current landing width is less than 0.90 m, necessitating a modification to the stair landing and possibly adjacent walls.

suggestions.action: Install a folding or retractable landing.
suggestions.reasoning: This innovative solution allows compliance without permanent structural changes, providing flexibility in space usage.

suggestions.action: Redesign adjacent spaces to create a wider landing area.
suggestions.reasoning: Reconfiguring the layout of adjacent walls can help achieve the necessary landing width while maintaining overall design integrity.

issue.description:
504.3 Open Risers
Stair SStair.1448 has a landing with clear width of less than the required 0.90 m.
issue.title: Stair.3.2

suggestions.action: Widen the stair landing to meet the 0.90 m requirement.
suggestions.reasoning: The current landing width is less than 0.90 m, necessitating an adjustment to comply with building codes.

suggestions.action: Install a folding or sliding door to maximize landing space.
suggestions.reasoning: Replacing the door with a folding or sliding option can free up landing space without structural changes.

suggestions.action: Redesign the stair to include a switchback for a wider landing.
suggestions.reasoning: A switchback design can create a wider landing area while improving accessibility.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair SStair.1456 has a landing with clear width of less than the required 0.90 m.
issue.title: Stair.2.2

suggestions.action: Widen the landing to meet the required width of 0.90 m.
suggestions.reasoning: The current landing width is less than 0.90 m, which does not comply with building regulations.

suggestions.action: Reconfigure adjacent spaces to create a more open area around the landing.
suggestions.reasoning: By removing non-load-bearing walls or relocating furniture, we can enhance usability and address the compliance issue.

suggestions.action: Install an alternative access solution, such as a ramp or lift.
suggestions.reasoning: This provides compliant access to upper levels without modifying the existing landing.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair Stair.0.1 riser height is 0.20 m. The maximum height for the risers is 0.18 m.
issue.title: Stair.0.1: 0.20 M

suggestions.action: Modify riser height to 0.18 m.
suggestions.reasoning: The current riser height of 0.20 m exceeds the maximum allowable height of 0.18 m, necessitating a redesign to comply with building codes.

suggestions.action: Install a stair lift for accessibility.
suggestions.reasoning: Installing a stair lift would provide an alternative solution for mobility challenges without altering the existing riser height.

suggestions.action: Add landings at intervals along the stairway.
suggestions.reasoning: Introducing landings would break up the height of the risers, allowing for compliance with building codes and enhancing user safety.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair Stair.2.1 riser height is 0.20 m. The maximum height for the risers is 0.18 m.
issue.title: Stair.2.1: 0.20 M

suggestions.action: Adjust the riser height to 0.18 m.
suggestions.reasoning: The current riser height of 0.20 m exceeds the maximum allowable height of 0.18 m according to building code compliance issue 504.2.

suggestions.action: Introduce intermediate landings to reduce effective riser height.
suggestions.reasoning: Adding landings can break the height into smaller segments, enhancing safety and accessibility while complying with the height requirement.

suggestions.action: Consider replacing the stair with a ramp.
suggestions.reasoning: A ramp could provide a more inclusive solution for users with mobility challenges and eliminate the riser height issue.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair Stair.3.2 riser height is 0.20 m. The maximum height for the risers is 0.18 m.
issue.title: Stair.3.2: 0.20 M

suggestions.action: Reduce the riser height to 0.18 m.
suggestions.reasoning: The current riser height of 0.20 m exceeds the maximum allowable height of 0.18 m, violating building code 504.2.

suggestions.action: Install a ramp adjacent to the stairway.
suggestions.reasoning: Adding a ramp would provide an alternative access route, accommodating individuals with mobility challenges.

suggestions.action: Reconfigure the stair design to include more treads with lower riser heights.
suggestions.reasoning: This would distribute the height over more steps, ensuring compliance with the building code while maintaining usability.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair Stair.2.2 riser height is 0.20 m. The maximum height for the risers is 0.18 m.
issue.title: Stair.2.2: 0.20 M

suggestions.action: Modify the riser height to 0.18 m.
suggestions.reasoning: The current riser height of 0.20 m exceeds the maximum allowable height of 0.18 m, necessitating a design adjustment.

suggestions.action: Introduce intermediate landings between treads.
suggestions.reasoning: Adding landings can break the height into smaller increments, improving safety and accessibility.

suggestions.action: Install stair nosing on the treads.
suggestions.reasoning: Stair nosing will enhance visibility and traction, mitigating risks associated with the increased riser height.

issue.description:
307.4 Reduced Vertical Clearance
Stair SStair.1448 has a landing with clear width of less than the required 0.90 m.
issue.title: Stair.3.2

suggestions.action: Modify the landing of Stair.3.2 to meet the required 0.90 m width.
suggestions.reasoning: The current landing width is less than 0.90 m, necessitating an increase to comply with regulations.

suggestions.action: Implement a folding or retractable landing for Stair.3.2.
suggestions.reasoning: This innovative solution allows the landing to expand to meet width requirements when needed, optimizing space usage.

suggestions.action: Reconfigure adjacent spaces to create additional room for the landing.
suggestions.reasoning: By moving walls or doors, we can create a compliant landing area while maintaining functionality.

issue.description:
504.3 Open Risers
Stair SStair.197 has a landing with clear width of less than the required 0.90 m.
issue.title: Stair.0.1

suggestions.action: Widen the landing area to meet the 0.90 m requirement.
suggestions.reasoning: The landing width is currently less than the required 0.90 m, necessitating structural modifications.

suggestions.action: Install a folding or retractable barrier to create a wider landing when needed.
suggestions.reasoning: This innovative solution allows for compliance during peak usage while maintaining space efficiency.

suggestions.action: Redesign adjacent spaces to create more room for the landing area.

issue.description:
307.4 Reduced Vertical Clearance
Stair SStair.1114 has a landing with clear width of less than the required 0.90 m.
issue.title: Stair.0.3

suggestions.action: Increase the width of the landing to 0.90 m.
suggestions.reasoning: The current landing width is less than the required 0.90 m, necessitating an increase to comply with standards.

suggestions.action: Install a foldable landing to maximize space and compliance.
suggestions.reasoning: A foldable landing can provide the necessary clearance when in use while conserving space when not needed.

suggestions.action: Reconfigure adjacent spaces to allow for a wider landing.
suggestions.reasoning: Adjusting the layout of surrounding areas can create the necessary width for the landing without altering the stair structure.

issue.description:
504.3 Open Risers
Stair SStair.1114 has a landing with clear width of less than the required 0.90 m.
issue.title: Stair.0.3

suggestions.action: Widen the landing to meet the 0.90 m requirement.
suggestions.reasoning: The current landing width is less than 0.90 m, necessitating an increase to comply with safety regulations.

suggestions.action: Install a spiral staircase to optimize space and meet width requirements.
suggestions.reasoning: A spiral staircase can fit within the existing footprint while providing adequate width and compliance.

suggestions.action: Reconfigure adjacent walls to create a wider landing area.
suggestions.reasoning: Adjusting the position of non-load-bearing walls can help achieve the necessary landing width.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair Stair.3.1 riser height is 0.20 m. The maximum height for the risers is 0.18 m.
issue.title: Stair.3.1: 0.20 M

suggestions.action: Modify the riser height to 0.18 m.
suggestions.reasoning: The current riser height of 0.20 m exceeds the maximum allowable height of 0.18 m.

suggestions.action: Redesign the stair with wider treads and lower risers.
suggestions.reasoning: A redesign can create a more gradual incline, enhancing comfort and accessibility.

suggestions.action: Consider replacing the stair with a compliant ramp.
suggestions.reasoning: A ramp would eliminate the riser height issue and improve accessibility for all users.

issue.description:
405.2 Slope
Ramp length is 3.00 m and slope is 10.0%. The maximum length for this slope is 1.52 m.
issue.title: Ramp.0.1: 3.00 M

suggestions.action: Reduce ramp length to 1.52 m.
suggestions.reasoning: The current ramp length of 3.00 m exceeds the maximum allowable length for a 10% slope, which is 1.52 m.

suggestions.action: Implement a switchback design for the ramp.
suggestions.reasoning: A switchback design can maintain the ramp length while reducing the slope to meet the 10% requirement.

suggestions.action: Add a landing area mid-ramp to break the slope.
suggestions.reasoning: Incorporating a landing area can allow for a longer ramp while keeping the slope within the acceptable limits.
